name: slackly
content:
slackly adverb
(LOOSELY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
loosely; not tightly: The wooden gates were hanging slackly on their hinges. A telegraph line hangs slackly over waste ground.
More examplesFewer examplesThe flesh hung slackly on his face as he gaped at the damage.The cable might have been fitted too slackly.A deflated life-jacket lay slackly on the dark sea.

(CARELESSLY)
carelessly or with less effort than usual: The country appears to have a very slackly policed border. The book has been slackly proofread, with some silly mistakes. See
